intro: Bulbocodium subluteum, commonly known as the yellow bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Bulbocodium subluteum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, well-drained conditions.
